args: Ah, {player_name}. Are you\npracticing the sword by yourself?
Well, if you like, perhaps I could spar with\nyou. I could at least manage to parry your\nswings, if that would be helpful.
Still, I'm a little surprised that you would\nvolunteer to spar.
I used to be quite poor at fighting,\nbut since arriving at the Halidom,\nthat has changed a little bit.
It's because I've been here with you and\nall the others, so thank you for that.
Heh. I didn't do anything, Melsa. It was\nall thanks to your own strength.
Well, in any case, I want to repay my debt\nto you.
I am truly grateful to you for saving both\nmy village and Sylvia.
You really don't have to thank me.\nI just did what anyone would do.
Anyway, let's get on with practice.\nI tend to train hard, so give this all\nyou've got!
You're strong, {player_name}—\nalthough that doesn't surprise me.
Maybe—but I have to get even stronger if I\nhope to save Zethia.
My little sister. She was stolen away by\nthe empire, and all I could do was watch.
I still regret it. If I'd only been stronger,\nthen maybe...
However, I understand how you feel.\nWhen Sylvia was captured by the empire,\nI also couldn't do anything but watch.
It's hard to see something—or someone—\nyou love taken away from you.
True. But you came and saved us both.
And now it's my turn to help you!
I'm going to help you save Zethia.\nIt's the only way to repay you for\nwhat you did for me.
I'm really happy to hear you say that,\nMelsa.
Er, but I'm really not that strong, so I'm\nnot entirely sure how much help I'll be.
Perhaps I should have thought a little\nmore before making such bold,\nimpassioned claims.
Hey, you don't have to be so modest.\nYou're a friend—and a dependable one\nat that.
You are too kind to me.
And you're too meek and self-effacing.
I think you might actually be like Zethia in\nthat way.
Yep. She's so kind and centered.
When we were kids, she would follow me\naround everywhere.
That's a really cute image. You two must\nhave been especially close.
Yeah. Zethia and I—and Notte—have\nalways been together.
And that's why our dream when we were\nyoung was to create a kingdom where the\nthree of us could live happily forever.
...Heh. Kind of silly to dream of a kingdom\nwith only three people in it, right?
Ha ha! Perhaps. But the main idea behind\nthe dream is still a good one.
When I lost that, it was the first time\nI realized just HOW important it was.
That's why I think that your childhood\ndream is absolutely wonderful.

I'm glad you think so. It's changed a little
bit—there are more people involved now,
for one—but the basic concept is still the
same as it ever was.
Except now I dream of creating a kingdom\nwhere EVERYONE can live happily.
Although now that I really think about it,\nit may not be quite accurate to call it a\ndream.
This isn't something I dream about doing\nsomeday—it's something I absolutely must\nand WILL do.
...Why is it that I want to stay with the\nprince even after I've repaid my debt?

I think the two of you—you and
{player_name}—are more alike
than you might think. Both unfailingly kind,
and both aiming for similar dreams.
But then if your dream is to make a place\nwhere everyone can be happy...
Um, {player_name}? Might I ask\nyou a question?
Well, this might sound weird, but I think it\nmeans that everyone can laugh together.
I know, I know. But laughter has always\nfelt like true happiness to me, so I guess\nit's something that I strive for.
For what is happiness if not being\nsurrounded by merry friends?
...And that's why I've made my decision!
Here and now, I swear to you that we will\nrescue Zethia!
And after that, I will offer up all that I am\nto help make your dream a reality!
But in that case, I have to repay your\ncourtesy with one of my own.
Ahem! In the name of the royal family of\nAlberia, I, {player_name},\naccept your request.
...Okay, that's enough of the formalities.\nYou can get up now.
B-but I've become your servant!\nWouldn't that be improper?

To be honest, I'm not really comfortable
with the idea of servants. I'd just prefer
to have a bunch of friends who all
support each other.
I'll be counting on you, Melsa.
I will remain by your side forever.
